<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/25/bob-iger-hands-disney-ceo-job-head-parks-bob-chapek?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bob Replaces Bob
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Bob Iger on Fox Business Network's " Markets Now" " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyNjcyMTY5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Michael Loccisano/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Kinda. Disney made the surprise announcement yesterday that 15-year CEO Bob Iger is <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/all/bob-iger-steps-down-ceo-disney-n1142781?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stepping down</a> almost two years ahead of schedule. Parks chief Bob Chapek is taking over…</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But still reporting to Iger, who will become executive chairman through 2021. Iger’s also taking over what NBC News calls “arguably the most important role at the company”—head of creative endeavors.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why now? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We could've saved a lot of time and prewritten this article in September when Iger dropped his book, literally titled <em>The Ride of a Lifetime</em>. But Iger had assured us that he had a succession plan in the works and would step down from the CEO role in 2021. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, <a href="https://thewaltdisneycompany.com/bob-chapek-named-chief-executive-officer-of-the-walt-disney-company/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Disney said</a> that after the successful launch of Disney+ and integration of 21st Century Fox assets, the time was right for the 97-year-old company to welcome its seventh chief executive. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Iger clarified the change was “not accelerated by any particular reason.” But because the switch-up was “effective immediately,” the Twittersphere started <a href="https://twitter.com/ballmatthew/status/1232415904408969222?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">theorizing</a> Iger’s finally running for prez.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Let’s get <em>Toy Story 3-</em>level sappy  </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bob Iger did for Disney what the Instant Pot did for meal prep. He <a href="https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2019/09/bob-iger-remembers-steve-jobs?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bought</a> Pixar in 2006, then struck deals for Marvel, Lucasfilm, and 21st Century Fox that now look like genius moves. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He reorganized the company, moved deeper into international markets (especially Asia), and made a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2019-11-07/inside-disney-bob-iger-on-star-wars-pixar-and-more?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">calculated jump</a> into streaming last fall. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Qualitatively, he did it all in Mr. Nice Guy fashion, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/22/style/disney-bob-iger-book.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the NYT reports</a>:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“In a town where everyone is always filleting everyone else, Mr. Iger floats above it all, cosseted in what some call ‘a cult of nice.’”</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Quantitatively, Disney’s stock rose more than 350% during his tenure. The company captured over a third of domestic box office revenue last year and signed up nearly 30 million to Disney+.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Chapek might’ve headed Disney’s biggest business unit for five years, but Iger’s left him a literal content kingdom. Chapek will need to squeeze all the juice from its legacy franchises and keep innovating.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/25/stocks-bond-yields-drop-cdc-warns-global-pandemic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Coronavirus Dominates Headlines...Again
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, U.S. health officials told Americans to get ready for a coronavirus outbreak on our shores. “It’s not so much a question of if this will happen anymore,” <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/25/health/coronavirus-us.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> a CDC official, it’s “more of a question of exactly when this will happen.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Markets: </strong>Stocks tanked for a second straight day. More than $1.7 trillion in value has been wiped from the S&P 500 so far this week. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The yield on the benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury note hit its lowest level on record.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The potential treatments: </strong>Biotech company Moderna said it <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/drugmaker-moderna-delivers-first-coronavirus-vaccine-for-human-testing-11582579099?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shipped</a> an experimental coronavirus vaccine to U.S. government researchers. Its stock was up nearly 28% yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The hot takes:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow: “We have contained this, I won’t say airtight, but it's pretty close to airtight” he told CNBC. That’s not what the CDC said…</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>International Olympic Committee senior member Dick Pound: “All indications are at this stage that it will be business as usual,” he </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/58043910be7bdc6818344bdee2096bc2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explained</a></span><span> to the AP about the upcoming Tokyo Olympics. But an ultimate decision about canceling the games could be made in late May. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/25/amazon-opens-first-cashierless-grocery-store?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Breaking: Amazon Sells 49-Cent Avocados
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Amazon Go store" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTc3L2FtYXpvbl9nb19zdG9yZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Amazon</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">OK, that’s the second-biggest news. Yesterday, the company <a href="https://apnews.com/623bd4cd2b6c949d9d9411090447c371?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">opened Amazon Go Grocery</a>—its first full-size cashierless grocery store—in Seattle's Capitol Hill neighborhood. The 10,400-sq.-ft. location joins 25 Amazon Go convenience stores around the country freeing shoppers from checkout lines and small talk. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it works: </strong>Scan yourself/your family into the store. Any items you leave with get charged to your tab. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it happened: </strong>Amazon incubated Go Grocery for five years with the goal of <em>not</em> cannibalizing Whole Foods, which it bought in 2017. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Go Grocery shares some suppliers and brands with Whole Foods, but its products are a little less “natural and organic” and a little more Oreo.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">A ripe time for grocery disruption </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Grocery is an $800 billion industry, but just 3% of U.S. groceries are <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/24/amazon-opens-its-first-full-size-cashierless-grocery-store-in-seattle.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ordered online</a>. From shelf-scanning robots to cashierless tech, retailers are trying to freshen up the in-store experience. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the end goal for Amazon is to license its cashierless technology to other retailers hoping to capture some of the Bezos magic.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CLIMATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/25/jpmorgan-plans-sever-fossil-fuel-ties?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
JPMorgan Goes Sage
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Chase Tower" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTYyL2NoYXNlX3Rvd2VyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Joe Mabel, Top of JPMorgan Chase Tower, CC BY-SA 3.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">JPMorgan <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/25/jpmorgan-says-it-will-fund-200-billion-in-sustainable-deals-this-year.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced plans</a> to reduce ties to the fossil fuel industry at its annual investor day yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The largest U.S. bank by assets’s plan to go green(ish): </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Restrict financing of new coal-fired power plants </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Phase out loans to the coal industry entirely by 2024</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Stop funding new oil and gas drilling in the Arctic </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Complete ahead of schedule a 2017 goal of facilitating $200 billion in deals that support the UN’s sustainable development goals</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> With President Trump in the White House and the Republican Party controlling the Senate, U.S. environmental activists have <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/climate-environment/jpmorgan-chase-takes-baby-step-toward-curbing-fossil-fuel-loans/2020/02/24/5932f82a-5745-11ea-9000-f3cffee23036_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shifted their focus</a> from pressuring the government to pressuring the private sector. Since JPMorgan was the top financier of the fossil fuel industry from 2016–2018, activists have turned the heat up to 11. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Or maybe to 12. Environmental advocates mostly scoffed at the bank’s announcement, observing that it still allowed for financing of oil and gas projects in the lower 48 states. Climate organizer and professor Bill McKibben called it “weak beer.”</p>

<tr>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY MICHIGAN ROSS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Need an Online MBA That Gets an A?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As an aggressively online business brand, we feel that we are uniquely positioned to discuss a very important topic with you: online MBAs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve heard from quite a few of you that online MBAs are on your radar, so we put <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/20/know-online-mba-makes-grade" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">together an article</a> that can help you understand what to look for (and avoid) when choosing a school.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While the factors can be as overwhelming as a three-exam Tuesday, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/20/know-online-mba-makes-grade" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">we’ve broken things down</a> in a way that anyone could understand them. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/20/know-online-mba-makes-grade" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">helpful little piece of business writing wizardry</a> (sorry for bragging, we’re just proud) covers all the topics you need to know—from career resources offered by the program to what to look for in professors to understanding the various online MBA formats. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So if you have Q’s about getting an online MBA, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/20/know-online-mba-makes-grade" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">check out our article</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/25/officials-blame-carmakers-regulators-failing-protect-consumers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
NTSB: Self-Driving Is Not a Game
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Inside a Tesla engaged in Autopilot " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTYzL2luc2lkZV9hX3Rlc2xhX2VuZ2FnZWRfaW5fYXV0b3BpbG90LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>jurvetson (Steve Jurvetson), Tesla Model S digital panels, CC BY 2.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) held a hearing yesterday to determine the probable cause of a fatal 2018 crash involving Tesla’s driver assistance system, Autopilot. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Autopilot can help Tesla vehicles change lanes and maintain speed and safe distances, but drivers still need to pay attention. Before the crash, the 38-year-old driver was <a href="https://apnews.com/d03d88fca7ef389ffbe3469f50e36dcf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">playing a video game</a> and it seems like he didn't see it coming. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tesla claims cars with Autopilot engaged have fewer accidents than the national average. But a 2019 Insurance Institute for Highway survey also found drivers overestimate Autopilot and are too comfy throwing their hands in the air at the tops of hills. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This isn’t just a Tesla problem </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NTSB Chairman Robert Sumwalt <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/25/business/tesla-autopilot-ntsb.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blamed</a> the auto industry and regulators for failing to protect consumers. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>He said carmakers that have installed driver-assist systems haven’t done enough to make sure drivers are keeping their eyes off Reddit and on the road. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sumwalt is skeptical regulators will listen to the NTSB’s recommendations given their “misguided” and “hands-off” approach in the past. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Sumwalt has a point. The industry can’t even agree on <a href="https://advocacy.consumerreports.org/press_release/joint-statement-aaa-consumer-reports-j-d-power-and-the-national-safety-council-unite-to-adopt-common-naming-for-advanced-driver-assistance-technology/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">what to call self-driving features</a>, let alone how to regulate them. Politicians and regulators have called out Autopilot specifically for its misleading name.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MUSIC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/25/streaming-crowned-king-music-business?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Stream On
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An image of the Spotify logo as a vinyl record on a smartphone " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyNjY2MzY5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Recording Industry Association of America’s (RIAA) 2019 year-end <a href="https://www.riaa.com/reports/riaa-releases-2019-year-end-music-industry-revenue-report/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">report</a> on the U.S. music industry is out, and we’d like to hand out some awards.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Business model of the year: </strong>Streaming. In 2019, streaming accounted for 80% of the $11.1 billion in total recorded music sales.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That includes premium subscription (fancy person Spotify), ad-supported on-demand (YouTube, regular person Spotify), and streaming radio (Pandora). </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Best revival: </strong>Vinyl. Sales from vinyl grew 19% for the category's biggest year since 1988. Turns out, nostalgia is lucrative...or the kids are watching <em>Almost Famous</em>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Worst revival: </strong>CDs, which experienced a 12% decline in revenue.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Best comeback story: </strong>Avril Lavigne...and the music industry. The biz had been limping along until 2016, when streaming showed up to fireman-carry it back to prosperity. Streaming in 2019 brought in more revenue than the entire recorded music industry in 2017, per the RIAA. </p>

</p>

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyNjcyMTY5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMichael Loccisano/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eKinda. Disney made the surprise announcement yesterday that 15-year CEO Bob Iger is \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/all/bob-iger-steps-down-ceo-disney-n1142781?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estepping down\u003c/a\u003e almost two years ahead of schedule. Parks chief Bob Chapek is taking over…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut still reporting to Iger, who will become executive chairman through 2021. Iger’s also taking over what NBC News calls “arguably the most important role at the company”—head of creative endeavors.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy now? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe could've saved a lot of time and prewritten this article in September when Iger dropped his book, literally titled \u003cem\u003eThe Ride of a Lifetime\u003c/em\u003e. But Iger had assured us that he had a succession plan in the works and would step down from the CEO role in 2021. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, \u003ca href=\"https://thewaltdisneycompany.com/bob-chapek-named-chief-executive-officer-of-the-walt-disney-company/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eDisney said\u003c/a\u003e that after the successful launch of Disney+ and integration of 21st Century Fox assets, the time was right for the 97-year-old company to welcome its seventh chief executive. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIger clarified the change was “not accelerated by any particular reason.” But because the switch-up was “effective immediately,” the Twittersphere started \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/ballmatthew/status/1232415904408969222?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etheorizing\u003c/a\u003e Iger’s finally running for prez.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLet’s get \u003cem\u003eToy Story 3-\u003c/em\u003elevel sappy  \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBob Iger did for Disney what the Instant Pot did for meal prep. He \u003ca href=\"https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2019/09/bob-iger-remembers-steve-jobs?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebought\u003c/a\u003e Pixar in 2006, then struck deals for Marvel, Lucasfilm, and 21st Century Fox that now look like genius moves. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHe reorganized the company, moved deeper into international markets (especially Asia), and made a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2019-11-07/inside-disney-bob-iger-on-star-wars-pixar-and-more?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalculated jump\u003c/a\u003e into streaming last fall. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eQualitatively, he did it all in Mr. Nice Guy fashion, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/22/style/disney-bob-iger-book.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe NYT reports\u003c/a\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“In a town where everyone is always filleting everyone else, Mr. Iger floats above it all, cosseted in what some call ‘a cult of nice.’”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eQuantitatively, Disney’s stock rose more than 350% during his tenure. The company captured over a third of domestic box office revenue last year and signed up nearly 30 million to Disney+.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eChapek might’ve headed Disney’s biggest business unit for five years, but Iger’s left him a literal content kingdom. Chapek will need to squeeze all the juice from its legacy franchises and keep innovating.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, U.S. health officials told Americans to get ready for a coronavirus outbreak on our shores. “It’s not so much a question of if this will happen anymore,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/25/health/coronavirus-us.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e a CDC official, it’s “more of a question of exactly when this will happen.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003eStocks tanked for a second straight day. More than $1.7 trillion in value has been wiped from the S\u0026P 500 so far this week. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe yield on the benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury note hit its lowest level on record.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe potential treatments: \u003c/strong\u003eBiotech company Moderna said it \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/drugmaker-moderna-delivers-first-coronavirus-vaccine-for-human-testing-11582579099?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshipped\u003c/a\u003e an experimental coronavirus vaccine to U.S. government researchers. Its stock was up nearly 28% yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe hot takes:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhite House economic adviser Larry Kudlow: “We have contained this, I won’t say airtight, but it's pretty close to airtight” he told CNBC. That’s not what the CDC said…\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eInternational Olympic Committee senior member Dick Pound: “All indications are at this stage that it will be business as usual,” he \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/58043910be7bdc6818344bdee2096bc2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexplained\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to the AP about the upcoming Tokyo Olympics. But an ultimate decision about canceling the games could be made in late May. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOK, that’s the second-biggest news. Yesterday, the company \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/623bd4cd2b6c949d9d9411090447c371?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopened Amazon Go Grocery\u003c/a\u003e—its first full-size cashierless grocery store—in Seattle's Capitol Hill neighborhood. The 10,400-sq.-ft. location joins 25 Amazon Go convenience stores around the country freeing shoppers from checkout lines and small talk. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow it works: \u003c/strong\u003eScan yourself/your family into the store. Any items you leave with get charged to your tab. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow it happened: \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon incubated Go Grocery for five years with the goal of \u003cem\u003enot\u003c/em\u003e cannibalizing Whole Foods, which it bought in 2017. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGo Grocery shares some suppliers and brands with Whole Foods, but its products are a little less “natural and organic” and a little more Oreo.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eA ripe time for grocery disruption \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGrocery is an $800 billion industry, but just 3% of U.S. groceries are \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/24/amazon-opens-its-first-full-size-cashierless-grocery-store-in-seattle.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eordered online\u003c/a\u003e. From shelf-scanning robots to cashierless tech, retailers are trying to freshen up the in-store experience. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe end goal for Amazon is to license its cashierless technology to other retailers hoping to capture some of the Bezos magic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJPMorgan \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/25/jpmorgan-says-it-will-fund-200-billion-in-sustainable-deals-this-year.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced plans\u003c/a\u003e to reduce ties to the fossil fuel industry at its annual investor day yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe largest U.S. bank by assets’s plan to go green(ish): \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRestrict financing of new coal-fired power plants \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePhase out loans to the coal industry entirely by 2024\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eStop funding new oil and gas drilling in the Arctic \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eComplete ahead of schedule a 2017 goal of facilitating $200 billion in deals that support the UN’s sustainable development goals\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e With President Trump in the White House and the Republican Party controlling the Senate, U.S. environmental activists have \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/climate-environment/jpmorgan-chase-takes-baby-step-toward-curbing-fossil-fuel-loans/2020/02/24/5932f82a-5745-11ea-9000-f3cffee23036_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshifted their focus\u003c/a\u003e from pressuring the government to pressuring the private sector. Since JPMorgan was the top financier of the fossil fuel industry from 2016–2018, activists have turned the heat up to 11. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOr maybe to 12. Environmental advocates mostly scoffed at the bank’s announcement, observing that it still allowed for financing of oil and gas projects in the lower 48 states. 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTYzL2luc2lkZV9hX3Rlc2xhX2VuZ2FnZWRfaW5fYXV0b3BpbG90LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ejurvetson (Steve Jurvetson), Tesla Model S digital panels, CC BY 2.0\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) held a hearing yesterday to determine the probable cause of a fatal 2018 crash involving Tesla’s driver assistance system, Autopilot. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAutopilot can help Tesla vehicles change lanes and maintain speed and safe distances, but drivers still need to pay attention. Before the crash, the 38-year-old driver was \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/d03d88fca7ef389ffbe3469f50e36dcf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplaying a video game\u003c/a\u003e and it seems like he didn't see it coming. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTesla claims cars with Autopilot engaged have fewer accidents than the national average. But a 2019 Insurance Institute for Highway survey also found drivers overestimate Autopilot and are too comfy throwing their hands in the air at the tops of hills. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis isn’t just a Tesla problem \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNTSB Chairman Robert Sumwalt \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/25/business/tesla-autopilot-ntsb.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblamed\u003c/a\u003e the auto industry and regulators for failing to protect consumers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHe said carmakers that have installed driver-assist systems haven’t done enough to make sure drivers are keeping their eyes off Reddit and on the road. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSumwalt is skeptical regulators will listen to the NTSB’s recommendations given their “misguided” and “hands-off” approach in the past. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eSumwalt has a point. The industry can’t even agree on \u003ca href=\"https://advocacy.consumerreports.org/press_release/joint-statement-aaa-consumer-reports-j-d-power-and-the-national-safety-council-unite-to-adopt-common-naming-for-advanced-driver-assistance-technology/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewhat to call self-driving features\u003c/a\u003e, let alone how to regulate them. Politicians and regulators have called out Autopilot specifically for its misleading name.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Recording Industry Association of America’s (RIAA) 2019 year-end \u003ca href=\"https://www.riaa.com/reports/riaa-releases-2019-year-end-music-industry-revenue-report/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereport\u003c/a\u003e on the U.S. music industry is out, and we’d like to hand out some awards.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBusiness model of the year: \u003c/strong\u003eStreaming. In 2019, streaming accounted for 80% of the $11.1 billion in total recorded music sales.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat includes premium subscription (fancy person Spotify), ad-supported on-demand (YouTube, regular person Spotify), and streaming radio (Pandora). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBest revival: \u003c/strong\u003eVinyl. Sales from vinyl grew 19% for the category's biggest year since 1988. Turns out, nostalgia is lucrative...or the kids are watching \u003cem\u003eAlmost Famous\u003c/em\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWorst revival: \u003c/strong\u003eCDs, which experienced a 12% decline in revenue.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBest comeback story: \u003c/strong\u003eAvril Lavigne...and the music industry. The biz had been limping along until 2016, when streaming showed up to fireman-carry it back to prosperity. Streaming in 2019 brought in more revenue than the entire recorded music industry in 2017, per the RIAA. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
